Package net.xqhs.flash.core.shard

Interface AgentShard

  • All Superinterfaces:
    net.xqhs.util.config.Configurable, ConfigurableEntity<Agent>, Entity<Agent>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MessagingShard
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMessagingShard, AbstractNameBasedMessagingShard, AgentShardCore, AgentShardGeneral, CentralGUI, ControlShard, GUIBoard, GuiShard, IOShard, LocalPylon.SimpleLocalMessaging, MonitoringShard, MonitoringTestShard, PingBackTestComponent, PingTestComponent, SwingGuiShard, WebSocketMessagingShard
    public interface AgentShard
extends ConfigurableEntity<Agent>
    A shard (also called a component) is characterized by its functionality, identified by means of its designation -- an instance of AgentShardDesignation.

    The purpose of shards is to encapsulate specific functionality that can be used by an agent (e.g. messaging, mobility, knowledge-management, etc). Various interfaces may extend this interface to provide APIs for common shards.

    An agent shard can only work as part of an agent. As such, it has access to a proxy to the agent which must be an instance of ShardContainer.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Method Detail

      • getShardDesignation

        AgentShardDesignation getShardDesignation()
        Retrieves the designation of the shard, so that one can know what services the shard offers. The designation should be related to the interface that the shard implements.
        Returns:
        the designation of the shard (as an instance of AgentShardDesignation).

      • signalAgentEvent

        void signalAgentEvent​(AgentEvent event)
        This method should be called by the agent containing the shard in order to signal to the shard that an agent event has been generated inside the agent. E.g. that the agent has been started or stopped.
        Parameters:
        event - - the AgentEvent that needs to be signaled to the shard.
